fields.description:
Dear all,

When importing a picture file (jpg, png) in attached file, we get this crash error :
Hibernate operation: Could not execute JDBC batch update; SQL []; Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`confluence`.`IMAGEDETAILS`, CONSTRAINT `FKA768048734A4917E` FOREIGN KEY (`ATTACHMENTID`) REFERENCES `ATTACHMENTS_BACKUP` (`ATTACHMENTID`)); nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`confluence`.`IMAGEDETAILS`, CONSTRAINT `FKA768048734A4917E` FOREIGN KEY (`ATTACHMENTID`) REFERENCES `ATTACHMENTS_BACKUP` (`ATTACHMENTID`))

It works fine with other file types (xlsx, docx, pdf, ...).
We are running Confluence 5.8.8, upgraded 6 months ago.

Many thanks for your help

Thierry Mignard - IT Manager Studyrama
fields.summary: crash when uploading picture files

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# Install Confluence 5.8.16
# Create a new page and save the page
# Install Confluence Source editor
# Click edit on the new page  and then find for '<>' to open the source editor  
# Add the following code
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="code"><ac:parameter ac:name="title">1st step source code</ac:parameter><ac:parameter ac:name="linenumbers">true</ac:parameter><ac:parameter ac:name="language">xml</ac:parameter><ac:parameter ac:name="collapse">true</ac:parameter><ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<config charset="UTF-8">
  
  <!-- get the page -->
   <var-def name="profile_page_url">
     <script return="pPage">
         <![CDATA[
           pPage = org.apache.commons.httpclient.util.URIUtil.encodeQuery(profile_page.toString());
         ]]]]><![CDATA[>
     </script>
   </var-def>
  
   <var-def name="profilePage">
      <html-to-xml>
    		<http url="${profile_page_url}"/>
      </html-to-xml>
   </var-def>
     
     <var-def name="company_name_link">
       <xpath expression="//*/div[1]/div[2]/div[2]/h3[1]/a[1]/@href">
              <template>${profilePage}</template>
          </xpath>
     </var-def>
     
   <export include-original-data="true" external-url="${profile_page_url}">  
    <single-column name="company_name_link" value="${company_name_link}" xpath="//*/div[1]/div[2]/div[2]/h3[1]/a[1]/@href"/>      
   </export>
	
</config>]]></ac:plain-text-body></ac:structured-macro>
{code}

*Observed behaviour*
The user won't be able to save the page. They will be seeing the following error:
!error.JPG!

*Expected Behaviour*
User should be able to save the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Multi-byte characters in Pie chart of JIRA Macro are not rendered, even after required font files are installed.

h3. Environment
* It happens when Confluence Server runs both on Windows and on Linux

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare vanilla CentOS 6.6 x64
# Install Confluence 5.8.16 using x64 installer
# Install license-free IPA Gothic fonts (font files for Japanese) applying the instruction in [Non-ASCII Characters display as square characters in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Non-ASCII+Characters+display+as+Square+Characters+in+Confluence]:
## Shutdown Confluence
## {{$ sudo yum -y install fontconfig}}
## Download the license-free IPA Gothic files (font files for Japanese) from [here|http://ipafont.ipa.go.jp/old/ipafont/IPAfont00303.php]
## Deploy the downloaded ttf files to {{/usr/share/fonts}}
## {{$ sudo mkdir /opt/atlassian/confluence/jre/lib/fonts/fallback}}
## Deploy the downloaded ttf files to {{/opt/atlassian/confluence/jre/lib/fonts/fallback}}
## Restart Confluence
# Install JIRA 6.4.12 on wherever you like
# Create a project and a issue on JIRA
# Attach a label in Japanese on the issue
# Create a space and create a page on Confluence
# Add a JIRA pie chart showing labels of JIRA issues
# Add a status macro in Japanese (this is just in order to make sure the fonts are successfully installed)
# Save the page
# You will see the Japanese string in the status macro is rendered, however, that in the JIRA pie chart is not rendered, but showing square characters. See also the attached

h3. Expected Results
Japanese string in JIRA pie chart is rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Japanese string in JIRA pie chart is not rendered, but showing square characters.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround found so far.
fields.summary: Multi-byte characters in Pie chart of JIRA Macro are not rendered

fields.description:
Reproduce:
* Open blank editor, click center align to center the whole paragraph
* Upload and insert an image in the paragraph, the image *appears as centered*
* Save the page, export to PDF. In PDF, the image *appears as left aligned*

Expected result:
The image is centered in the PDF
fields.summary: Images in centered paragraph are left aligned in PDF export

fields.description:
Right now there are 2 ways to center an image:
# Put cursor in the containing paragraph and click the align button. This way the whole paragraph content, including the image, is centered.
# Select only the image and click the align button. In this case, the image will have extra CSS class 'image-center'. This usage looks weird in editor and causes many bugs. I can understand how align left/right can be applied to image (they make the image float left/right and text floats around the image), but don't know how align center is useful to image.
As the latter way makes no sense, we should remove it.
fields.summary: Remove special "center image" feature in editor
Double scrollbars in notiification

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39960].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Table of Contents macro links do not redirect to the appropriate heading on the page when the Documentation theme is used in the space. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version 5.9.1-OD-2015.47.1-0002
* Space uses *Documentation Theme* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space and apply the [Documentation Theme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/the-documentation-theme-724764776.html]
# Create a new page with several headings, add the *Table of Contents* macro
# Save the page, and attempt to click on one of the heading links in the table of contents

h3. Expected Results
# You are re-directed to the appropriate heading on the page

h3. Actual Results
# You are not re-directed
 
h3.Workaround
# Right clicking on a link and opening in a new window will place you in the correct area of the page. 
# A better solution would be to [switch to the default global look and feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/switch-to-the-default-theme-762877014.html] for confluence, as the [Documentation theme is being discontinued|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/07/13/Announcement%3A+Some+Confluence+features+are+going+away]
# To make use of [_Table of Content Zone Macro_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] instead of _Table of Contents Macro_.
#* When using the ToC Zone macro, ensure all content is placed in the body of the macro. The Table of contents is generated based on headings inside the macro body.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro links do not work when using Documentation theme

fields.summary: Avoid NPE when trying to translate null key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39958].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
This problem deals with creating new anchors in Confluence Cloud. When anchors are created using the Table of Contents Macro in Confluence Cloud, it has been observed that some links update the URL in the browser navigator but do not navigate to those links.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. Environment:
- Google Chrome Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit)
- Firefox 42.0
- Safari Version 9.0 (10601.1.56.2)

# Using Document Theme
# Create anchors in Confluence using the Table of Contents Macro
# Select any of the links

h3. Expected Results
It should navigate to the expected link.

h3. Actual Results
The links do not work.
 
h3. Notes
Nothing is thrown in the logs or the browser console.
Only affects Document Theme. Global Look and Feel doesn't have this problem.

h3.Workaround
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25 Nov 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
As covered in: [This Comment Below | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39958?focusedCommentId=832859&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-832859]
Dear All,

Thanks for taking the time to raise and comment on this issue. Unfortunately the Documentation Theme will be discontinued in Confluence v6.0. So we have decided to close this as won't fix
More information could be found at: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/07/13/Announcement%3A+Some+Confluence+features+are+going+away

Regards
Minh Tran
Confluence Bugmaster
Atlassian
{panel}

After you click on the anchored link, the URL in the browser will update but nothing will happen. Click on the URL in the browser navigator and click Enter. That will take you to the desired page.

OR

Windows - Right Click, or MAC Control+Click, on the link and select open in new tab

OR

Update theme to Global Look and Feel

OR

Use of [_Table of Content Zone Macro_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] instead of _Table of Contents Macro_.
fields.summary: Conf Cloud Anchors made by Table of Contents macro don't work

fields.description:
The {{CacheBackedLuceneSearchMapperRegistry}} is supposed to be updated whenever a plugin event occurs.

However this is not working in Confluence 5.9.1-beta4 because the {{searchMapperRegistry}} field in {{LuceneSearchMapperRegistryCacheUpdateListener}} is always null (probably due to autowiring issues).

The effect of this behaviour is that the {{LuceneSearchManager}} can only use mappers provided by plugins that were already enabled before the first search request is being processed (because the cache inside {{CacheBackedLuceneSearchMapperRegistry}} is filled on first request).

Mappers provided by plugins installed later on are not visible until Confluence is restarted.

This causes several key features of the Scroll Versions plugin to break, therefore I'm setting the priority to 'Critical'.
Please let us know if you require a 5.9 compatible pre-release version of Scroll Versions for testing. The versions currently available on the market place are not yet compatible with 5.9.*.
fields.summary: CacheBackedLuceneSearchMapperRegistry isn't updated on plugin events in 5.9.1-beta4

The customer found there is a wrong translation in Confluence Workbox.

"$username liked this" is translated as "$username liked この" in Japanese.
$username is variable here.

"$username liked この" is a quite strange in Japanese grammar and this sentence is partially translated. 
In French, "$username liked ce/cette" comes up. I think this is also wrong translation.

Should be "$username がいいね!しています" (key is *likes.summary.1.non-promoted* in TAC)

!you liked this.png|thumbnail! 

I tried to fix it on TAC but there is no entry for this and cannot find source code (mywork-confluence-host-plugin).

Please fix this.

We are using Confluence on premise on Linux Debian system. Our Confluence build is 5.8.8.

We have recognized many issues with the Windows Webdav client so we decided to use the tool Netdrive. The only issue (as seems so far) remaining in comparison to the Windows problems we have had is the following:

We can drag&drop PPTX documents either to the Windows or the Netdrive client to the Webdav drive and it is possible to open this PPTX file (e.g. 8 MB) through the web editor. But double-clicking either on the Windows Webdav client or the Netdrive client Powerpoint is asking for a repair of the file. It seems that the file is corrupted. Reducing the size of the file to under 2 MB the file opens correctly.

fields.description:
The cluster safety mechanism is not working for 5.8.x Server editions of Confluence. This removes a safety net that prevents multiple Confluence instances from inadvertently updating the same database, which could lead to unexpected data corruption.

For example, this can happen when cloning the production environment to create a test environment, and the step to update the database connection to point to the test environment is missed. In this scenario, both the Prod and Test Confluence instances would be updating the same DB.

h3. Symptoms
* The {{clustersafety}} table contains no rows (expected behavior: contains 1 row)
* Multiple 5.8.x Server instances can connect to the same Confluence database and not fail (expected behavior: cluster panic)

h3. Other notes
* Confluence 5.7 and below Server and Data Center editions have working cluster safety mechanisms, as expected
* Confluence 5.8.x Data Center edition has a working cluster safety mechanism as expected
* This affects 5.8.1 Server and above

*Testing notes*:
 - Start 2 standalone nodes of confluence, point them to the common DB
 - Ensure that cluster safety job is scheduled and running
 - Ensure that one node panics when cluster safety job runs

Cluster configuration check:
 - Set up CDC locally (2 nodes)
 - Ensure that safety job runs and nodes don't panic (you may want to set logging level to debug for com.atlassian.confluence.cluster.hazelcast.HazelcastClusterSafetyManager)
 - Emulate network outage between nodes. I used pfctl utility for that:
{code}
sudo pfctl -e
(sudo pfctl -sr; echo "block drop quick on lo0 proto tcp from any to any port = 5802") | sudo pfctl -f -
(sudo pfctl -sr; echo "block drop quick on lo0 proto tcp from any to any port = 5801") | sudo pfctl -f -
sudo pfctl -v -s rules
{code}
To clean up filtering:
{code}
sudo pfctl -f /etc/pf.conf
{code}
 - one node should panic on when safety job runs.
fields.summary: Cluster safety not enabled for Confluence 5.8.x Server Edition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39924].
  {panel}

On the attachments screen ([^file-attachments-screen.png]) , and on the attachment macro ([^attachment-macro.png]), clicking the attachment link in certain versions of IE (9,11) prompts the user with a dialog to Open, Save, or Save As the file. 

This can be confusing to users that are accustomed to the "Edit in Office" functionality, especially if they're not aware of the actual link for editing in Office. And so clicking the link will open the file in read-only mode, but in order to edit the file the Office application will prompt the user to enable editing, and once the user does so it will attempt to fetch the file from the Confluence server but _without proper credentials_, which results in the Office application reloading with the contents of the Confluence log in screen. 

Creating a separate "Download" link (for the attachments screen) or button (for the attachments macro) and grouping it with the other links or buttons may be better for usability.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add an Office document to a Confluence page
# On the page, go to Tools > Attachments
# With IE11, click the attachment link and click Open on the resulting dialog
# Enable editing in the Office application
fields.summary: Unlink attachment links and add a download link/button instead

h3. Summary
JIRA Macro renders the Fix Version/S column empty when there are multiple Fix Version/S after it is upgraded to 5.6.17

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.8.13 with JIRA Macros 5.6.17

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Confluence 5.8.13 with bundled JIRA Macros 5.6.12
# Insert JIRA Macros showing Fix Version for issue with multiple fix versions
# View that multiple fix versions are shown in the column
# Upgrade JIRA Macros to 5.6.17
# View the same JIRA Macros

h3. Expected Results
* Fix Version/S column would render with all fix versions

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing is rendered in the Fix Version/S column
 
h3. Notes
* If there is one fix version, then it will render properly

h3.Workaround
# Uninstall JIRA Macros 5.6.17
# Restart Confluence - this will load up the bundled JIRA Macros.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39921].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In 'Product Requirement' pages in Confluence with Epic links, if we navigate to a different page and then back to the page, we get this error in the JIRA issue macros:
{panel}
Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. Precondition Failed
{panel}

When using back/forward button on a browser, it can miss loading the JIRA issue on a page and will also get the same error.

h3. Environment
Only tested in Chrome and using JIRA and Confluence Cloud.
JIRA version: 7.0.0-OD-08-005, 7.1.0-OD-03-049

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JIRA+Confluence Cloud instance
# Create 2 projects in JIRA
# In one, create an Epic
# Create a "Product Requirement" and add that Epic in the Epic row in the column
# Add some other JIRA Issue macro to another issue
# Go to the Confluence page
# Navigate to some other page in the same tab (so there's an option to go back to the previous page)
# Go back to the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
The Confluence page is displayed as before

h3. Actual Results
The second time the page is accessed, this error is shown in the issue macros:
{noformat}
Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. Precondition Failed
{noformat}
This error is visible in the browser console:
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientId/50c07907-2dc4-4c08-885c-f19b101eb484 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 412 (Precondition Failed)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Simply refresh the page and the macro will be fixed.
fields.summary: "Precondition Failed" error when redirected to Confluence page with Epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39920].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence admin, I would like the Livesearch Macro's autocomplete to suggest results after a couple of letters and not after typing the first word of my search.

h5. Example:
# Create a test space named *TEST*
# Create a parent root page called *Contacts*
# Create various sub-pages under the *Contacts* page with names 
** *UserA Test, UserB Test, UserC Test* and add a label named contactlabel
# Add a *Livesearch* macro to the root page Contacts
# Use the *Restrict to this Space Key* property to restrict it to the current space
# Use the *Restrict to label(s)* property to restrict it to the contactlabel label.
# Go to the *Contacts* page and search for *UserA Test*
# Notice the suggestion only comes up after typing the compete first word UserA. This can be misleading as end user's believe there are no results when typing only the first couple of letters (e.g. Use)


h3. Suggested Solution
 Suggested results may be displayed after typing the first few letters of the search term and not the first complete word.

h3. Workaround 
None so far
fields.summary: As a Confluence admin, I would like the Livesearch Macro's autocomplete to suggest results after a couple of letters

fields.description:
h4. Summary
OAuth token is referring to the old URL after recreating the Application Link between Confluence and another Atlassian application(eg. JIRA)

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.4
Confluence 5.8

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Application Link directly between JIRA and Confluence
# Link Confluence page into JIRA issue and put this JIRA issue key into the linked page
# Authenticate the link to trigger token creation between JIRA and Confluence
# Change Base URL in both JIRA and Confluence(example could be switching from FQDN to localhost)
# Remove Application Link in both JIRA and Confluence
# Re-create Application Link
# Revoke any tokens and generate a new OAuth token by authenticating the link from JIRA issue and from a Confluence page

h4. Expected Results
OAuth token in JIRA is referring to the new URL and application name
!correctURL.png|thumbnail!

h4. Actual Results
OAuth token in JIRA is referring to the old URL
!incorrectURL.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
- Follow the steps to remove the Application Links directly from the database in both JIRA and Confluence:
-- [How to remove Application link directly through JIRA database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+remove+Application+link+directly+through+JIRA+database]
-- See resolution section on [Application Link configuration cannot be deleted via the UI and appears as System Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Application+Link+configuration+cannot+be+deleted+via+the+UI+and+appears+as+System+Link] for Confluence
fields.summary: OAuth token is referring to the old URL in Confluence

Side bar does not scroll correctly when logged in as administrator on long pages

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1
* Internet Explorer 11, Google Chrome (latest), Mozilla Firefox (with smooth scrolling turned off) on Mac and PC.
* The operating system is set to jump 2 or 3 lines with page scrolling

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with [lots of content|http://generator.lorem-ipsum.info/], so that the left scroll bar appears in the browser.
# Log in as administrator
# Go to the page created in step 1
# Use the mouse wheel to scroll down three lines
# Use the mouse wheel to scroll up three lines

h3. Expected Results
The side bar moves down with the page content.

h3. Actual Results
The side bar stays at the top and blocks the menu

!bug.PNG|thumbnail! 
!chrome.png|thumbnail!
!ie11.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Occurs also with arrow keys, but not as extreme.
Doesn't occur on Chrome for Linux.

h3.Workaround
* refreshing the page

or
* pressing [ twice (it hides and un-hides the side bar)
fields.summary: Side bar does not refresh when logged in as administrator and scroll up

h2. Summary

When inserting a web link using Firefox, the insert button appears to do nothing.  The link does not insert and it stays on the web link macro page

h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page
# Select the 'Edit' option from the top right menu
# Select the *link* button from the top menu
# Enter a web link in the weblink section; Enter a name for the link below
# Click the *insert* button

h2. Expected Result

The link will insert and show on the page

h2. Actual Result
The *insert* button appears to do nothing as it does not insert and the *insert link* page remains

h2. Environment
Confluence 5.7
Linux Ubuntu
Firefox

h2. Workaround
# Edit a page
# use the shortcut to start a link - type [
# after [ , <your text> - then | and control/command v to past the link the you want inside the last bracket
*It is important to note that you will not be able to right-click when trying to perform this action. It must be done using the command ‘v’ paste function for the actual link*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39892].
  {panel}

The pdf indexer throws a lot of error messages when indexing pdf files. 
{code}
ERROR [Indexer: 3] [apache.pdfbox.filter.FlateFilter] decode FlateFilter: stop reading corrupt stream due to a DataFormatException
{code}
This is probably caused by a bug in the pdfbox. 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PDFBOX-2497

The bug above is fixed in 1.8.8 although we are using 1.8.10 and still seeing the error message. it can possibly be a regression.

h3. Workaround : 
(!) Do note that this workaround is only tested in small instances and if you're facing any issues after applying this, restore back the PDFBOX version to the default bundled version and clear the plugin cache with a restart.
(!) This is only applicable if your PDFBOX version is 1.8.x.

# Download this [PDFBOX version 1.8.12 here|http://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox/1.8.12/pdfbox-1.8.12.jar]
# Shutdown Confluence
# Go to {{<Confluence Installation Directory>\confluence\WEB-INF\lib}} and search for PDFBOX 1.8.xx jar file. Remove the jar file and keep it somewhere in a non-Confluence folder.
(!) It is important not to leave two versions of the same plugin jar file in the installation directory as all of them will be deployed upon start up.
# Insert the PDFBOX 1.8.12 version here.
# Clear the plugin cache
#- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+clear+Confluence+plugins+cache
# Start Confluence

The errors will not appear again after a content index.
fields.summary: PDF extractor throws data format exception error in logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39887].
  {panel}

I'd like to see the Confluence status macro changed in a couple of ways. 

First the status macro changes the words and the colors separately. That means that anybody who edits the page has to remember what each color means and what word should be used for each status. Further, there can be inconsistent use of colors on a single page. I want the statuses to be set up so that the page creator can predefine the color/status messages at the start.

Second I'd like to see the status color/message to be changeable without going into edit mode.

To sum it all up, perhaps the best way to implement these two suggestions is to make the word and color combinations editable from the edit mode. Then enable the user to toggle the right status from the read mode.
fields.summary: Status macro suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Installing Confluence 5.8.16 on a 32-bit version of Windows using the 32-bit installer, atlassian-confluence-5.8.16-x32.exe, results in an error message "Could not use bundled JRE. Please send this log file to your software vendor:

Log: C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\Temp\i4j_nlog2"

h3. Environment

* Windows 32-bit

h3. Notes

i4j_log attached. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download atlassian-confluence-5.8.16-x32.
# Run the installer on a 32-bit version of Windows

h3. Expected Results

Installation completes successfully using the built-in JRE.

h3. Actual Results

Error is presented on screen and the installation will not continue: 

"Could not use bundled JRE. Please send this log file to your software vendor: Log: C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\Temp\i4j_nlog2"

Following is found in the i4j_log:

{code}Setting PATH C:\Windows\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\
ERROR: Could not get DLL-Handle.
ERROR: Could not load functions
ERROR: Could not load bundled JRE. Trying to find another JRE.
LoadDLL (0, (null), 0)
Searching for a JVM
GetTempPath returned 37 (last error 3)
make dir returned -1
Testing location  (type Y)
GetTempPath returned 37 (last error 183)
make dir returned -1
Testing location JAVA_HOME (type E)
GetTempPath returned 37 (last error 203)
make dir returned -1
Testing location JDK_HOME (type E)
Search sequence finished
ERROR: No JVM found
ERROR: Could not find another JRE.{code}
 
h3.Workaround

# Download and install the appropriate JDK (1.8)
# Set the [Java_Home Variable|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/setting-the-java_home-variable-in-windows-8895.html]
# Re-run the installer

If Confluence does not start, you *may* need to do the following steps below:

*If you did not choose to start Confluence as a Windows service:* 
# Go to <confluence_install>/bin
# Edit the file setenv.bat
# Modify the JRE_HOME path to point to the installed JDK. For example:
{code}JRE_HOME=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\jre"{code}
replace with: 
{code}"JRE_HOME=C:\Progra~1\Java\jdk1.8.0_65"{code}
# Start Confluence

*If you choose to run Confluence as a service*: 
# Follow [How to switch from the bundled JRE to System Java when using Confluence as Windows Service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+switch+from+the+bundled+JRE+to+System+Java+when+using+Confluence+as+Windows+Service] to update the JRE.  
(!) The article refers to tomcat7w, however, this version of Confluence runs on tomcat8w.  Replace tomcat7w with tomcat8w.
# Start Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence 5.8.16 installation on Windows fails with an error "Could not use bundled JRE. Please send this log file to your software vendor:"

h3. Problem Definition
A user's overseas team may make updates during their business hours which are not included by midnight but would be included if the email were sent at 5:00 AM , for example.

The 5:00 AM time may only be appropriate for specific users so it would be handy if it could be set in the user's profile rather than globally on the Scheduled Jobs page.

h2. Workaround
Work around this problem by first restoring the site backup into 5.6 ([link to the archives|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives/]), then re-create the backup. Doing this will "fix" the backup file to contain the correct set of fields, and therefore, can be restored into 5.7 or later (including cloud instances).

fields.description:
Pages with Custom Javascript stored in an HTML macro from the /Confluence-Install/confluence/includes/js directory are now taking over twenty (20) seconds to load when refreshing or loading a page. Javascript URL renders immediately, but some background process is occurring that is causing pages to wait for twenty (20) seconds before loading completely.

Shown in the screenshots from Firefox and Canary below:

!https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356572/Screen%20Shot%202015-11-10%20at%208.44.01%20AM.png|width=800,height=600!
*Firefox Firebug NetExport Capture*

!https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356571/Screen%20Shot%202015-11-10%20at%208.51.36%20AM.png|width=800,height=600!
*Chrome Developer Tools Capture*

I am attaching HAR Files from these tests to the case herein as well as [canary.har|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356587/canary.har] and [firefox.har|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356586/firefox.har] both of which show the 20+ seconds delay just on page load and refresh.  This is only referring to page load and does not include the page editing as they have implemented a workaround previously provided for that issue. 

h4. Steps to Reproduce the Issue
# Create a custom.js file - in this case I used *both* the client's custom javascript file and a simple sample.js file to test the issue. Both test cases produce the same resulting slowness
# Place the custom.js file in the /Confluence-Install/confluence/includes/js directory and insure that the permissions and ownership are the same as the rest of the files in the directory
# Whitelist the localhost URL and context path in the Confluence Admin interface (was checking this as a possible avenue for the slowness - did not help or harm the issue)
# In a Space, create a Page to test the Javascript Include function
# Create an HTML macro on that page
# insert the following code within the macro: {code} <script type="text/javascript" src="/CONTEXT_PATH/includes/js/custom.js"></script> {code} (i) *NOTE*: the CONTEXT_PATH should match the context for the instance and the *custom.js* file should match the name of your custom.js file as it exists in the instance as well, or this will not work
# Save the page
# Refresh the page and observe the twenty second (20 sec.) load time induced when the call is made
# Initial reports in Firebug and Developer Tools do not show the delay until the Javascript is loaded.
# Go to the URL path http://localhost/context/includes/js/custom.js and take note that the page loads the javascript immediately, *however*, the spinner in the browser does not stop loading for a bit longer even though the javascript has rendered in the browser. Not sure why that is occurring, but this too loads slowly at 20+ seconds, even though the script renders immediately
in the browser, the *actual delay* still persists in a direct render. This is captured in the file [firefoxdirect.har|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356632/firefoxdirect.har] which is attached as well.

h4. What is known
This problem did not occur in Confluence Standalone or Datacenter 5.7.5, but does occur in Confluence Standalone and Datacenter 5.8.13 and 5.8.14. Something has changed in between the two branches that is causing slow-loading of the includes in Confluence. Not sure what might be causing this, so hopefully the HAR files and browser tests will provide some insight. I am also including the MP4 files that [~kyong] created and attached to [CONF-39799|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39799] which show the [reproduction of the issue in Confluence 5.8.14|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356643/Confluence-5.8.14-Reproducible.mp4] and the [non-reproduction in Confluence 5.7.5|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1356644/Confluence-5.7.5-Non-Reproducible.mp4] as well for your review herein. 

h4. Workaround
The only known workaround here is to disable the
fields.summary: Custom Javascript includes cause pages to load slowly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Installing Confluence 5.8.16 on Windows results in an error message "Could not use bundled JRE. Please send this log file to your software vendor:

Log: C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\Temp\i4j_nlog2"

h3. Environment

* Windows 64-bit 

h3. Notes

i4j_log attached. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download atlassian-confluence-5.8.16-x64 or atlassian-confluence-5.8.16-x32.
# Run the installer on a Windows system.

h3. Expected Results

Installation completes successfully using the built-in JRE.

h3. Actual Results

Error is presented on screen and the installation will not continue: 

"Could not use bundled JRE. Please send this log file to your software vendor: Log: C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\Temp\i4j_nlog2"

Following is found in the i4j_log:

{code}Setting PATH C:\Windows\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\
ERROR: Could not get DLL-Handle.
ERROR: Could not load functions
ERROR: Could not load bundled JRE. Trying to find another JRE.
LoadDLL (0, (null), 0)
Searching for a JVM
GetTempPath returned 37 (last error 3)
make dir returned -1
Testing location  (type Y)
GetTempPath returned 37 (last error 183)
make dir returned -1
Testing location JAVA_HOME (type E)
GetTempPath returned 37 (last error 203)
make dir returned -1
Testing location JDK_HOME (type E)
Search sequence finished
ERROR: No JVM found
ERROR: Could not find another JRE.{code}
 
h3.Workaround

# Download and install the appropriate JDK (1.8)
# Set the [Java_Home Variable|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/setting-the-java_home-variable-in-windows-8895.html]
# Re-run the installer

If Confluence does not start, you *may* need to do the following steps below:

*If you did not choose to start Confluence as a Windows service:* 
# Go to <confluence_install>/bin
# Edit the file setenv.bat
# Modify the JRE_HOME path to point to the installed JDK. For example:
{code}JRE_HOME=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\jre"{code}
replace with: 
{code}"JRE_HOME=C:\Progra~1\Java\jdk1.8.0_65"{code}
# Start Confluence

*If you choose to run Confluence as a service*: 
# Follow [How to switch from the bundled JRE to System Java when using Confluence as Windows Service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+switch+from+the+bundled+JRE+to+System+Java+when+using+Confluence+as+Windows+Service] to update the JRE.  
(!) The article refers to tomcat7w, however, this version of Confluence runs on tomcat8w.  Replace tomcat7w with tomcat8w.
# Start Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence installation on Windows fails with an error "Could not use bundled JRE. Please send this log file to your software vendor:"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39846].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently the only option we have to enable or disable the Membership Aggregation in Confluence is by running a REST call to disable/enable it, as described in [Managing Multiple Directories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/managing-multiple-directories-229838494.html#ManagingMultipleDirectories-NonAggregatingMembership]:
{code}
# To GET the current setting
curl -H 'Accept: application/json' -u <username> <base-url>/rest/crowd/latest/application

# To PUT the setting
curl -H 'Content-type: application/json' -X PUT -d '{"membershipAggregationEnabled":true}' -u <username> <base-url>/rest/crowd/latest/application
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Give administrators the ability to tell Confluence to use a non-aggregating membership scheme in the directory configuration UI so they don't need to use a REST call.

h3. Workaround 

Use the [API Browser plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser] to perform the call and disable it.
fields.summary: Add option to enable or disable membership aggregation in the directory configuration UI

fields.description:
A user without access to the page still received notification for an in-line comment on this page.
The notification was received in the notifications box, not via email.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page.
# Get multiple users to watch/upload attachments to the page.
# Restrict the page to only some user.
# Comment on the page.

*Expected Result*
Only the user who have edit/view restriction of the page will get workbox notification of the comment.

*Actual Result*
All user who watch/upload attachments to the page will receive workbox notification of the comment.
fields.summary: Users who contribute to a page (watch/upload attachment) get comment notification even the page have been restricted to only some user.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39834].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On the first login on Confluence, users are forced to start watching a space so they can go through "Welcome" screens. This is not ideal especially if users don't even know if the contents are relevant when first signing in.
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-06 at 11.27.22 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be a "Skip" button.
 
h3. Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Allow users to go through Welcome screen without having to start watching a space
